content: it in half for each arm  the arm will attach to the body on an angle to form shoulders line the shoulders up with the frog body side seam at a point below the mouth the frog body is now complete bend the legs at a point to form knees and the arms to form elbows at each point using yarn and the yarn needle run a tacking stitch from back to front and to the back again tie off and hide yarn ends bow tie using red yarn and 4mm hook create the bow tie panel of c2c 3 tiles wide and 12 tiles long fasten_off yarn fold panel in half and stitch the short ends together this will be the back of the bow tie with the yarn end tie a knot around the bow tie to cinch in the middle work a length of chain long enough to cover the cinched in middle of the bow tie work a second row of half_double_crochet back along the chain and finish with a 3rd slip_stitch row fasten_off and stitch this strip around the middle of the bow weave in ends set the bow tie aside using chain stitch work a length of chain long enough to go around the frog s neck snugly work a second row of half_double_crochet back along the chain and finish with a 3rd slip_stitch row fasten_off and stitch this strip onto the middle of the front of the frog attach and stitch down the bow tie over the middle of the neck band weave in ends variations for larger frog  use larger hook and yarn  use floristry wire in lieu of chenille sticks in legs and arms i used 40cm long 18 gauge wires and bent the ends under using pliers lengths of wires may require trimming  use larger 20mm safety eyes  work a red mouth  work a scarf using scarf main colour yarn and 5 5mm hook create the scarf in c2c 2 tiles wide and 45 tiles long fasten_off yarn and weave in ends create the scarf trims in a contrasting yarn i cut 3 lots of 30cm lengths and attached the three groups of yarn using larks head knots to each end of the scarf and then neatly trimmed yarn ends to the same length
